greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of maximal subsets of {1, 2, ..., n} containing n and having pairwise coprime elements.
comment: The elements of a maximal subset are 1, n, and powers of primes that have no common factor with n. The cardinalities of maximal subsets is A186971(n).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = Product_{p in Primes with p<n and GCD(n,p)=1} floor(log_p(n)).
example: a(5) = 2 because there are 2 maximal subsets of {1,2,3,4,5} containing 5 and having pairwise coprime elements: {1,2,3,5}, {1,3,4,5}.
maple: a:= n-> mul(ilog[j](n), j={ithprime(i)$i=1..pi(n)} minus factorset(n)):
mathematica: a[n_] := Product[Log[p, n] // Floor, {p, Select[Range[n-1], PrimeQ[#] && GCD[n, #] == 1&]}]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 200}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 09 2014, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Cf. A186971. Rightmost elements in rows of A186972.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 01 2011
